docs.snippet: Sports Direct's embattled chairman Keith Hellawell was re-elected on Thursday after company founder Mike Ashley backed him, ensuring he would stay in the role despite being opposed by a majority of the retailer's independent shareholders....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sports Direct's embattled chairman Keith Hellawell was re-elected on Thursday after company founder Mike Ashley backed him, ensuring he would stay in the role despite being opposed by a majority of the retailer's independent shareholders.

headline.main: Sports Direct Chairman Stays on Thanks to Founder's Backing
headline.print_headline: Sports Direct Chairman Stays on Thanks to Founder's Backing

docs.snippet: China is investigating two Communist Party officials in the restive western region of Xinjiang on suspicion of "serious disciplinary breaches", the graft watchdog said on Thursday, using a common euphemism for corruption....

docs.snippet: British new car registrations hit a record 2.69 million units in 2016 despite concerns from some analysts that June's Brexit vote would dent sales but demand will fall by around 5 percent this year, a car industry body said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: British new car registrations hit a record 2.69 million units in 2016 despite concerns from some analysts that June's Brexit vote would dent sales but demand will fall by around 5 percent this year, a car industry body said on Thursday.

headline.main: UK New Car Sales Hit Record High in 2016 but Signs of Slowdown Ahead-SMMT
headline.print_headline: UK New Car Sales Hit Record High in 2016 but Signs of Slowdown Ahead-SMMT

docs.snippet: The man who killed 39 people in an attack on an Istanbul nightclub on New Year's Day is probably an ethnic Uighur and Turkish security services now know where he might be hiding, Deputy Prime Minister Veysi Kaynak said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The man who killed 39 people in an attack on an Istanbul nightclub on New Year's Day is probably an ethnic Uighur and Turkish security services now know where he might be hiding, Deputy Prime Minister Veysi Kaynak said on Thursday.

headline.main: Turkey Says Istanbul Nightclub Attacker Probably Uighur
headline.print_headline: Turkey Says Istanbul Nightclub Attacker Probably Uighur

docs.snippet: Order cancellations are not a major risk factor for the aerospace industry this year, a senior Airbus executive said on Thursday, dampening concerns about a downturn in the aerospace industry's cycle amid fragile global economies....

docs.snippet: Britain's shock vote to leave the European Union has yet to scare off overseas investors, who are snapping up British government bonds at the fastest pace on record, figures on Wednesday showed....
docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's shock vote to leave the European Union has yet to scare off overseas investors, who are snapping up British government bonds at the fastest pace on record, figures on Wednesday showed.

headline.main: No Brexit Panic Yet as Foreigners Buy UK Bonds at Record Pace
headline.print_headline: No Brexit Panic Yet as Foreigners Buy UK Bonds at Record Pace

docs.snippet: King's Cup holders Barcelona have a fight on their hands if they are to remain in the competition after losing a fiery first leg of their last-16 tie at Athletic Club 2-1 on Thursday despite playing the final 10 minutes with a two-man advantage....

docs.snippet: Apple Inc removed the New York Times Co's news apps from its app store in China on Dec. 23, following a request from the Chinese authorities. An Apple spokesman said the company had been informed that the app was "in violation of local regulations...
docs.lead_paragraph: Apple Inc removed the New York Times Co's news apps from its app store in China on Dec. 23, following a request from the Chinese authorities. An Apple spokesman said the company had been informed that the app was "in violation of local regulations".

headline.main: Factbox: Apps Removed From Apple's China App Store
headline.print_headline: Factbox: Apps Removed From Apple's China App Store
